There is also periventricular and subcortical white matter hypodensity, consistent with small vessel ischemic disease. A right cerebellar lacunar infarct is also noted. There is a large destructive lesion involving the vertex of the calvarium. There is no underlying brain mass lesion or brain abscess, although there is an extra- axial, likely subdural, soft tissue/fluid component to this lesion, although this is difficult to evaluate due to volume averaging at the vertex and the lack of reconstructions. This does not appear to be of primary CNS etiology. Differential includes infectious process or a subcutaneous or osseous malignancy. Further evaluation with contrast-enhanced MRI is recommended.  2.
